content.description: This is one of the harder options for a climb on Pine Rock. Starting on the right-hand side of the wall, you want to be using the bulge to the right of the shallow crack that starts Right? Right!
content.protection: You can set up a possible TR anchor using a long enough static and some size 6-10 nuts. Currently there is poor ground placement for pads.

content.description: Thanks to the shape of the top of the cliffs, this climb actually has a move or two of non-slab climbing! It is a fun end to what's otherwise just like most of the climbing on Pine Rock's Main Wall. The climb isn't a good place for the existing bolts, but you can make your own anchor with a mix of natural pro and some nuts, or just treat it like a highball boulder and bring pads.
content.protection: There is potential to make your own TR anchor with a long static or plenty of space for pads if you're going to boulder it.
content.location: Start along the left-hand side of the wide cleft on the right of the main wall.

content.description: Rather than traversing around ledges/following the crack, just climb straight up! While you can actually pick many places from the ground between the start of "Fish In A Barrel" and "Debit Only", starting slightly to the right of "Almost Like Fish In A Barrel" and going up past the ledges you'd use for that climb make this one of the harder routes you can pick on the Main Wall.
content.protection: There are bolts on top of the cliff-face.
content.location: It is slightly less than halfway along the left side of Pine Rock's Main Wall.

content.description: Start to the right of the main face on the right edge of an overgrown corner, and follow the crack up. This doesn't use feet to the left of the crack.
content.protection: Natural anchors are possible with a long static rope. There are some placement for artificial pro, and you have some ability to place pads near the base.
content.location: On the right side of the main wall, start directly right of the right edge of a wide, shallow crack.

content.description:
New toproping bolts were installed for Boston Parks & Rec., August 2018.

 Walk around the rock until you find the way up. The bolts are roughly centered over the slab.
content.protection: Two pairs of bolts at the top.
content.location:
The parking is located at 42.268870,-71.123701, or across from 270 Austin St., Hyde Park.

 The trailhead is newly rehabbed with large boulders and peat - you'll see it on your right as you approach 270 Austin St. It's maybe 30 feet from there to the crag.

 There is also access via park trails.

content.description: Start to the left of the brown stain, and travel as straight up as you can. The thin crimps lead up to a small mantel,with an easier section up to the top. I am naming it after the "credit card" style crimps at the start.
content.protection: The top of the route is bolted.
content.location: It is directly under the rightmost pair of bolts on the Main Wall of Pine Rock.

climbs.name: Almost Like Fish In A Barrel

content.description: Starting to the right of Fish In A Barrel, travel up and to the right along the series of small ledges, topping out near the middle of the main wall.
content.protection: There are a pair of bolts on the top of Pine Rock.

content.description: Visible from the Austin Street Entrance, the Main Wall is a beautiful low-angle slab around 25 feet tall. 3 pairs of bolts on the top of the Wall allow for a wide variety of climbs, and a mix of natural and artificial protection can be used to set up topropes where there are no bolts.
